page.title: 12FARMS AROUND SWINDERBY.
page.content: Land in this area has always been used for {farming.} There were many small farms but it is now in larger units. In 1985{Potter Hill Farm}on the A46 is a pig farm owned by Mr.Laird.He has 130 sows that are kept inside all the time and are fed on meal and cereal. The sows usually have 2.2 litters a year with 10 - 12 piglets in each litter. The piglets are sold at 20 weeks for pork and the sows are kept until they have had 7 litters. If pigs are put with strange pigs they will fight each other. Mrs. Laird keeps chickens and sells the eggs. Farmers in this area grow root crops of carrots, parsnips, potatoes and sugar beet and some also grow wheat, barley, peas, beans and oilseed rape. {High Park Farm}on Collingham Road is now used as Boarding Kennels.
